availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John P. Swinford (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky. Kentucky native. Son of William Swinford and Married to Sarah D. Terry Swinford in Harrison County, Kentucky, on October 24, 1853. Father of McCauley Swinford and Berrenice Swinford. Resident of Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 101A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 604.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Berryville, p. 83B.
"John Patterson Swinford (1828-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #81484582, accessed October 14, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81484582.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, 1831-1867, Film #000216896.
